intro: Lippia schaueriana, commonly known as Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and striking blue or purple flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
